text: testified as follows ....
- - - EXAMINATION

Mr. Spohn, my name is Bruce Hess. I represent the Plaintiff in a case that he brought against you for injuries resulting from a motor vehicle accident on December 30th, 2016 on Route 309 around Quakertown.  I'm going to ask you a series of questions that pertain to this case. Have you ever testified before in court or at a deposition?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  There's several rules I want you to follow during the course of your deposition.  I don't anticipate we'll be here long. First of all, obviously, tell the truth.  Number two, this is done on a question and answer basis, so I ask a question, you give an answer.  I ask a question, you give an answer.  Try and wait for me to finish my question before you answer, and I will try and wait for you to finish your answer before I ask another question.  In other words, the court reporter can't take down both of us talking at the same time. If you do not understand a question, please ask me to rephrase it, and I'll be happy to do that.  If you answer a question, I will assume that you understood the question.  If a question calls for a yes or no answer, say "yes" or say "no." Don't shake or nod your head. If at any time you want to take a break, talk to your lawyer, use the bathroom, whatever.  That's perfectly okay. Just let me know.  Okay?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Lastly, is there any reason that you can't testify truthfully or honestly today because of illness, medication or otherwise?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: State your full name, please.
speaker: MR. HESS

text: David Matthew Spohn.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And where do you live at the present time?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: 308 Ashford Lane in Hereford, PA.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how long have you lived there?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I will be there approximately 12 years.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What is your marital status?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I'm married.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you live with your wife at that address?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you have children?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes, but they don't live with me. They're older.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Are you employed at the present time?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what do you do for a living?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I am a welder fabricator.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what's the name of your employer?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: J & T Technologies.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what's the location that you work at?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: In Pottstown, Pennsylvania.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long have you been employed by them?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: A little bit more than 12-and-a-half years.  It will be 13 years in November.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What's your date of birth?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: September 26th, 1965.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you have a valid driver's license?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how long have you been licensed driver in Pennsylvania?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Since the age of 17, so I'm 53. I'm trying to do the math.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Are there any restrictions on your driver's license?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Has your driver's license ever been suspended or revoked for any reason?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you wear glasses to read or drive?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: To read, yes.  To drive, no.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  The vehicle you were operating at the time of this accident was a 2016 Dodge Dart; is that correct?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And were you the owner of that vehicle?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how long had you owned that vehicle?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Actually, at that time, it was six months.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And would you agree with me that the accident involving the Plaintiff and you happened on December 30th, 2016 at about 12:56 p.m.?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yeah.  Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And would you agree that the accident happened on 309 southbound just north of Station Road in Quakertown, PA?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.  I'm not sure of the cross street, but yeah.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Do you recall what the weather was like at the time?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I know it was cold.  No snow, no rain.  Sunny, probably.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: As I recall, this happened on a Friday; do you recall that sitting here today?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I believe it was a Friday, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Had you or did you work that day?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I did in the morning.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what hours did you work that day?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: From 7:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And at 11:00 a.m., you were done working for the rest of the day?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And was that a normal shift, to work four hours?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: No.  It was an early day for the holiday, the upcoming holiday.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you worked in Pottstown that morning?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what did you do from there?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I left my employer.  I went to a financial institution in Quakertown where I have a loan, and then I was heading to Telford to look for another job at the time.  I didn't realize they closed early that day, and proceeded to head back to my residence when the accident occurred.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How far did you live from the location where the accident happened, approximately, either in my miles or travel time?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I mean, were you 10 minutes away, 15 minutes away?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: If I have to make an approximation, probably 20 minutes maybe.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  So at the time of the accident, you were heading home?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Now, at the time of the accident, were you familiar with the location where the accident happened, and I mean Route 309, in that vicinity?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Not really.  I wasn't, no.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what do you mean by "not really?"
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I traveled through that area before not knowing that -- like, I don't know it to the best of my knowledge.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I mean, had you ever proceeded southbound on 309 where this accident happened before the day of the accident?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  And do you recall how many times?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Not many.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you remember the last time before the accident?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Wow.  Maybe a year or two before then, that portion of 309.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where this accident happened with the Plaintiff, were you familiar with how many lanes there were on Route 309?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: When the accident occurred, I was not familiar with the third lane where the accident happened, which was the turn lane.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Now, the intersecting road south of where the accident happened was called Station Road.  Do you know how far that was, Station Road, from where the impact of the accident happened?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I don't.  I know I could see the traffic light.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  And it was controlled by traffic lights, that intersection?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Now, it's my understanding you were exiting a parking lot at the time of the accident --
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- is that correct? Had you ever exited that parking lot before the date of this accident?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what were you doing in that parking lot?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Turning around from heading to Telford.  I realized that the place was closed, where I was going, so I turned in that parking lot to do a U-turn and come out.  And I was in the lot, and it was congested traffic, so when they had stopped me, I came across the two lanes not realizing a third lane was there when he hit me.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you stop at a store that was in that parking lot --
speaker: MR. HESS

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- for any reason?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And I understand there's a Peruzzi's in that vicinity; is that correct?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I think.  It sounds familiar.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And there's an adult store there.  You didn't stop at either of those stores?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: No, I didn't.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you didn't get out of your car in that parking lot; you were just turning around?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And it was your intention on exiting that parking lot to cross the southbound lanes of Route 309, and turn left on northbound 309; is that correct?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: That's correct.  Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Mark these as Spohn-1 and 2.
speaker: MR. HESS

text: (Documents were marked for identification as Deposition Exhibit Spohn No. 1 and Spohn No. 2.)

Mr. Spohn, I'm showing you two photographs -- one is an aerial photograph, and the other is a ground photograph -- and ask if you're familiar with what these photographs show?  And they're marked Spohn-1 and Spohn-2.
speaker: MR. HESS

text: No.  I'm not familiar with them.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: On Spohn-2, there shows an Adult World sign there.  Does that refresh your memory as to what this is a photograph of?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: That's the parking lot I turned around in.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Are you able, looking at either photograph, to mark where you exited from the parking lot in an effort to cross the southbound lanes?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Probably right around here (indicating).
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can you put an X there?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: (The witness complies.)
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So, the Defendant has put an "X" on a driveway which exits the parking lot which he was exiting at the time of the accident.
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Do either of these photographs show where the impact with the Plaintiff's car occurred?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: In this turn lane (indicating).
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Can you, on Spohn-2, give me -- draw a line showing the path of travel of your car before impact?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Do you want me to, like, put an arrow?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yeah.  Yeah.  Just draw a line with an arrow.
speaker: MR. HESS

text: (The witness complies.)
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So that line you've drawn across Spohn-2 indicates your path of travel up until the time of impact; is that correct?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Now, this photograph shows two lanes of travel, two southbound lanes that you crossed, correct?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And the impact happened in the left-hand turn lane for Route 309 south, correct?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: That's correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you see these double lines here that separate southbound and northbound traffic?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you see those lines before the impact that day?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Can you rephrase the question?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yeah.  Sure. Would you agree with me that these two lines shown in Spohn-2 separate northbound traffic from southbound traffic?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall seeing those two lines that day before the accident happened?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  And when did you first see those double yellow lines?  Was is it before the impact, or was it after?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: It was before.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how much sooner -- how much prior to the accident did you see those -- or let me rephrase it. Where was your car when you first noticed those yellow lines?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I was here in the lot (indicating).  The traffic was congested. They had -- these two lanes of traffic had stopped, and they -- both lanes had waived me to come out that it was okay.  And when I came across this lane of traffic, I saw this yellow line proceeded into this lane in front of him.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  So before you crossed the two lanes, the two through lanes, for southbound traffic, is it your testimony that you saw this double yellow line?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I saw the yellow line when I cleared these two lanes of traffic and as soon as I entered into that turn lane.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'm sorry.  Maybe I'm not phrasing it right.  Where was your car the first time that you saw these double yellow lines; where was it that day?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Probably in this lane here (indicating), the two second passing lane.  Yeah, the second lane of traffic here.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The second through lane?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  And when you saw those double yellow lines, did that indicate to you that there was actually another turning lane for southbound traffic?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And why not?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I don't understand what you mean.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When you saw these double yellow lines, didn't that indicate to you that that separated southbound from northbound traffic?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I don't -- I was unaware that there was a turn lane there when I came out.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Before you attempted to cross the southbound lanes of Route 309, how would you describe traffic on 309 at that time?  In other words, was it light, moderate or heavy?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Very congested.  Very heavy.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When did you first notice, if at all, the color of the traffic light at the intersection with Station Road?  Was that before you exited the parking lot or after?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I didn't notice the color of the traffic light.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Just before you exited the parking lot, had the traffic in front of you for southbound 309 stopped?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: They had stopped and gave me an opening to come out, and when I proceeded through, I went into the turn lane where he hit me.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And the opening was created by vehicles in both of the through lanes?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Correct.  Yup.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did anybody wave you on to cross in front of them?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Both drivers in both lanes did.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: With a hand gesture?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were there any vehicles stopped behind them at that time?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: In what you now know as the left-hand turn lane as shown in those photos, did you see any vehicles moving in that lane before you started to cross?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I didn't.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: It's my understanding the collision happened in the left-turn lane on southbound 309; is that correct?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know what your speed was at the time of impact?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I don't recall.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know if your foot was on the gas or on the brake petal at the time of the impact?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I was on the gas, but it wasn't -- I don't know my speed.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know if your vehicle was accelerating at the time of the impact?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I'm going to say yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Before you started to exit the parking lot until the time of impact, at any time did you look to your right or to your left?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I looked to my right, I looked to my left, and then I looked back to my right and proceeded out.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you looked to your right, your left and your right before you started to exit the parking lot?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I looked to my right, I looked to my left, and I pulled out.  And I looked to my right and proceeded across the two lanes, and didn't look to my left.  And got into the lane, and he was there.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  So you looked to your left once before you started to exit --
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- the parking lot; and then after you exited the parking lot, you looked to your right, but not to your left again?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever see the Plaintiff's vehicle before impact?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I did not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  At the time of the accident, were you aware of the speed limit for 309 at that location?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what was it?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: 40, I believe.  It was no more than 40, I believe.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Once you had crossed the two through lanes on 309 southbound, were you then in the process of turning left when the impact happened?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Was I in the process of turning? Uh, I think I was going more straight to turn left.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Well, once you had crossed those two through lanes, you now assumed that your vehicle was in the northbound lane, correct?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I don't understand how -- can you rephrase it?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Well, you thought that there were only two lanes southbound --
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- at that location at the time of the accident, correct?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So once your vehicle entered the third lane, I assume that you thought you were now entering the northbound --
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Where were you looking at the time of the accident?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Straight into the northbound lane to make my turn.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You were looking straight ahead?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Your headlights, were they on or off; do you recall?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I don't recall.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Your vehicle, when you start it up, do the headlights just go on automatically?  Did you have it set that way?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You did not?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: No, I did not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  When you were crossing the southbound lanes of 309 in order to turn left, did you consider that action dangerous?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes, I did.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And why was that?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Because of the heavy volume of traffic.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you know if it was illegal to do what you were doing?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: No, I did not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.
speaker: MR. HESS

text: START mark that 3 and 4.
speaker: MR. HESS

text: (Documents were marked for identification as Deposition Exhibit Spohn No. 3 and Spohn No. 4.)
Mr. Spohn, I'm showing you two photographs marked as Spohn-3 and Spohn-4.  They show two different vehicles. Can you identify either one of those vehicles?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.  Number 3 is my vehicle.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And does Number 3 show the damage that was caused by the accident with the Plaintiff?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes, it does.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And that damage, it looks like it's confined to the driver's side front?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Can you identify what is shown in Spohn-4 at all?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I believe it's the Plaintiff's vehicle.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have an opportunity to look at the damage to his vehicle after the accident?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I did not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have a cell phone with you at the time of the accident?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I did.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you using your cell phone for any purpose at the time of the accident?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I was not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where was the cell phone located in the vehicle at the time of the accident?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: It was in my console.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Describe what happened at the scene after the accident occurred.
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I had gotten out of my vehicle.  I had checked the damage on my vehicle. There was, I believe, a volunteer firefighter that had gotten there, like, right away.  He had stopped all traffic and notified the police, and then I proceeded over to the Plaintiff's vehicle and walked back to my car.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And then what happened?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Then I was just waiting for the arriving of the police.  And I had made a phone call to my wife at the time letting her know that I was involved in an accident and was going to have to find a ride to get her home from work, because she doesn't have a driver's license, and waited until the police arrived.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you injured in this accident?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I was not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have an opportunity to speak to the Plaintiff at the scene of the accident?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: No, I didn't.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you make any observations about him at the scene of the accident?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I didn't, no.  I did not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you see him get out of the vehicle or stay in the vehicle, or --
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I didn't see him get out of the vehicle.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did an ambulance ever arrive at the scene?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes, it did.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did they take the Plaintiff?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I'm assuming they did.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  And was your vehicle towed from the scene?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And was it totaled as a result of the accident?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Could you say that again?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was your vehicle totaled as a result of the accident?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: No, it wasn't.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  So it was repaired?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you talk to anybody at the scene of the accident other than, perhaps, the police?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Just the volunteer firefighter that arrive shortly after the accident happened.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what did you talk to him about?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I just told him that it was my fault, and I had come out across the two lanes into the Plaintiff's path.  And then waited until the police arrived, and gave my statement to them.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Were you given any traffic ticket as a result of this accident?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Mark this as 5.
speaker: MR. HESS

text: (Document was marked for identification as Deposition Exhibit Spohn No. 5.)
Mr. Spohn, do you recall giving a recorded statement to your insurance company after the accident?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I don't recall.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I want to show you what's been marked Spohn-5.  They have you down as David "Stone" because it sounded like David Stone.  But I want you to take the opportunity to read through this, and then I'll be done.
speaker: MR. HESS

text: (The witness complies.)
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: (Reviewing document.)
So, Mr. Spohn, I've given you what's been marked as Spohn-5, and it is a transcribed statement given by a person identified as Dave Stone.  Do you recognize that as your statement to Progressive?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is there anything in that statement, having read it just now, that is inaccurate or that needs to be corrected or amended?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Well, other than my last name, it has "Colt's Auto Body."  It was actually Kulp's Auto Body.  Other than that, everything looks like -- everything looks in order otherwise other than that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So other than those two corrections, everything is accurate?
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Thank you. That's all I have auto.
speaker: MR. HESS

text: I have no questions.  Thank you.
speaker: MR. LAVIN

text: Thanks for your time.
speaker: MR. HESS

text: Thank you.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: (Witness excused.)
(Deposition concluded at 2:30 p.m.)
